DOC.brief_summary: The null hypothesis study combination solifenacin Percutaneous Tibial Nerve Stimulation ( PTNS ) different PTNS alone . However investigator anticipate 20 % improvement patient receive combination therapy measure OAB-q ( Overactive Bladder questionnaire ) score .
DOC.brief_title: Use Percutaneous Tibial Nerve Stimulation With Solifenacin Placebo Treat Refractory Overactive Bladder
DOC.criteria: 1 . 18 year age old 2. history overactive bladder 3. history inadequate response prior current treatment anti muscarinic medication , unacceptable side effect higher dose antimuscarinic medication 4 . PTNSnaive 5. willing discontinue use antimuscarinic agent 2 week start study medication ( `` wash '' ) 6. able swallow retain oral medication 7. able willing participate full duration study 8. able read write ( health outcome questionnaire selfadministered ) understand instruction relate study procedure give write informed consent 9 . OABq ( item 18 ) score 30 high 1. presence cardiac pacemaker and/or defibrillator 2. history urinary retention 3. history gastric retention 4. uncontrolled narrow angle glaucoma 5. unstable , serious coexist medical condition ( ) include , limited , myocardial infarction , coronary bypass surgery , unstable angina , cardiac arrhythmia , clinically evident congestive heart failure , cerebrovascular accident within 3 month prior Screening visit 6. abnormal liver function test ( great 3 time upper limit normal alanine aminotransferase [ ALT ] , aspartate aminotransferase [ AST ] , alkaline phosphatase [ ALP ] ) ; bilirubin > 3 time upper limit normal 7. history illness ( include psychiatric ) , opinion investigator , might confound result study pose additional risk subject 8. know hypersensitivity solifenacin 9. participation investigational market drug trial within 30 day prior first dose study drug time study period 10. pregnancy try become pregnant 11. breastfeeding
